DaD.item

Class ItemInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • DaD.item.ItemInstance

  • public class ItemInstance
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Clovis on 06/03/2017. This is this instance of an item, this is what the player will have in his inventory and what is dropped by monsters. Each instance is created from a template.
    See Also:
    ItemTemplate

    • Field Summary

      True if the item is equipped.

    • Field Detail

      • _stack

        private int _stack
        The number of item this instance has.

        This is really useful when having potion or 10 times the same item. Rather than having 3 times the same item, we will it only once but with a stack value of 3. BE CAREFUL EQUIPPED ITEM CANNOT BE STACKED! IT WILL BE 2 DIFFERENT INSTANCES!

      • _equipped

        private java.lang.Boolean _equipped
        True if the item is equipped.

      • _itemTemplate

        Template of the item instance.
        See Also:
        ItemTemplate

    • Method Detail

      • getTemplate

        public ItemTemplate getTemplate()

      • getStack

        public int getStack()
        Return the value of stack.
        Returns:
        int

      • addStack

        public void addStack(int stack)
        Add X stacks to the item instance.

        BE CAREFUL! Here we do not verify if we overpass the maximum stack of the item template! This must be verified before calling this function.

        Parameters:
        stack - Number of stack to add

      • retrieveStack

        public void retrieveStack(int stack)
        Remove X stacks to the item instance.

        BE CAREFUL! Here we not verify if number of stacks goes below 0! This must be verified outside of this function.

        Parameters:
        stack - Number of stack to remove.

      • equip

        public void equip(Hero hero)
        Make the hero Equip this item instance, check full description for important details!

        The function first check if there is an item equipped at the place where we'll equip the new item. If so then we unequip it first and then equip the new one. Then we re-calculate all the stats for the hero.

        Parameters:
        hero - The hero who equip the item.
        See Also:
        Calculator.calculateAllStats(Hero)

      • unequip

        public void unequip(Hero hero)
        Make the hero unequip this item by changing his _equipped value and then re-calculate his stats
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero that will unequip the item.

      • unequipWithoutCalculate

        private void unequipWithoutCalculate()
        Set the value of _equipped to false.

      • isEquipped

        public java.lang.Boolean isEquipped()
        Return true if item Instance is equipped.
        Returns:
        Boolean
